Greetings from The IronYard Academy for Front-End Engineering. My name is Shane Sniteman. I am ready, able, and motivated to assist Weebly in making functional and attractive web page templates. With graduation approaching (April 15), I have the necessary front-end skills to become an integral part of the most forward looking digital company on the planet. See my resume for work before my web development life!
About Me

In the days of inflated resumes and cover letters, let me shock you.

I have not climbed the Himalayas, swam the Ganges, or been selected by the Voice for my three octave range — nor have I written code that will transform the world — at least not yet. What I can say is after 2.5 months of Front End Engineering at the demanding The Ironyard Academy, I am smart enough to know what I don’t know, know where to find the answers to my questions, and am not afraid to ask when I come to a roadblock. And, I can code — well.

I now live in the world of JavaScript, have replaced my Facebook diet, (which is so yesterday), with Github, and can put any non-coder into an instant coma talking about functions, arrays, arguments, syntax, etc. But even though I know how to get down into the weeds, I am also a strategic thinker who also understands the big picture.

I came from a classical liberal education background (Furman University grad), worked and succeeded at PwC, understand the corporate world, and was forward thinking enough to leave a great job via a sabbatical to pursue the new tomorrow via web coding. After 15 hour days drinking from the firehose of amazing developers in an immersion course, I am hooked. I think world, write in code. I understand global, parse it to code. I am now a front end engineer. And, I believe I can be an asset to Weebly.
